name: OWASP API risk mitigations (APIM controls)
description: Translate common API security risks into concrete APIM controls and validations.
decision: Which gateway-level controls do you enforce in APIM vs leaving solely to backend services?
whyItMatters: APIM can reduce risk by enforcing consistent baseline controls at the edge of your API program.
Gateway controls improve visibility and standardization, but backend controls are still required for defense in depth.
Client requirements often include rate limiting, auth enforcement, and logging constraints.
checklist: Rate limiting and quotas for public or partner APIs (protect backends).
JWT validation for token-based auth where identity is required.
CORS configuration aligned with allowed origins (avoid permissive defaults).
Request/response transformations only when required; keep policy complexity bounded.
Logging with data minimization (avoid credentials, tokens, and PII).
validation: Verify throttling behavior under load (429 responses and retry guidance).
Verify JWT validation rejects invalid issuer/audience/signature configurations.
Verify CORS does not allow unintended origins.
Verify logs do not contain sensitive data.
pitfalls: Over-reliance on gateway checks (backend still needs authorization enforcement).
Overly complex policies that are hard to reason about and test.
Misconfigured CORS (either too permissive or blocks legitimate clients).
